abstract: One day before announcing it would spend $6.8 billion to buy the retail brokerage A.G. Edwards, Wachovia talked about a different kind of green. On Wednesday, the nation’s fourth-largest bank said it would build only environmentally friendly branches by the end of 2008, starting with eight it plans to open soon in southern California. The move follows large “green” commitments recently announced by the nation’s largest banks, Citigroup and Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: One day before announcing it would spend $6.8 billion to buy the retail brokerage A.G. Edwards, Wachovia talked about a different kind of green. On Wednesday, the nation’s fourth-largest bank said it would build only environmentally friendly branches by the end of 2008, starting with eight it plans to open soon in southern California. The move follows large “green” commitments recently announced by the nation’s largest banks, Citigroup and Bank of America.

headline.main: Wachovia Hops on the Green Bandwagon
